intro: Lindelofia lanata var. ovatifolia, commonly known as the woolly lindelofia, is a flowering plant native to South America, particularly Brazil. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy, ovate leaves and showy, pinkish-white flowers that bloom in summer. It thrives in humid, tropical environments and is often found in shaded, moist forest understories. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and as a houseplant.
